column5: It is tough to buck the Fisher Effect! Only hope (same for the rest of the world really)...dynamism-inducing supply side reform. Never politically/socially easy...but making the most of a big economy with potential never is

UK RNS today #5 - Asos - no change in guidance but total order placed +30%, retail GM up 80bps St James Place - gross inflow of funds +29%, group FUM up 20% DMGT - reduced FY guidance maintained

UK RNS today #4 - Greene King - 'traded well' over Xmas but first 37 weeks lfl down 1.4% due to food. But profit up helped by ongoing cost savings Foxtons - 'solid' but expects trading to be challenging thru 2018 but believe well placed esp due to strong balance sheet

UK RNS today #3 - Anglo American - 5% increase in total production despite removing higher cost volumes esp in copper Dechra - acquisition of generic vet products AST Farma and Le Vet for Euro340m including 100m placing

UK RNS today #2 - Restaurant Group - still lfl declines but profit inline with hopes, 'good progress' on their turnaround plan Great Portland Estates - returning £306m to shareholders following property sales. Said tenant interest 'healthy'

UK RNS today #1 - Diageo - holding previous guided hopes as all regions contributed, 'cash flow continued to be strong' Sky - 'consistent execution of strategy', with EPS +11%, div up 4%. Big issue the ultimate ownership
